body_html:
Not really, but this did!

The StackOverflow thread says that this is a bug in TF but in fact I simply did not have to all of the GPUs on the machine. It works fine if I do.

More generally, I suppose the issue is error messages. Would have saved me a lot of time if TF let me know that it doesn't have permissions to access a GPU but obviously I don't know enough about the internal workings of the framework to know how feasible this is at this point in time.

body:
Not really, but [this](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35805595/tensorflow-failed-to-run-on-k20m-and-k40m-gpus) did!

The StackOverflow thread says that this is a bug in TF but in fact I simply did not have to all of the GPUs on the machine. It works fine if I do.

More generally, I suppose the issue is error messages. Would have saved me a lot of time if TF let me know that it doesn't have permissions to access a GPU but obviously I don't know enough about the internal workings of the framework to know how feasible this is at this point in time.
